question: what are gross and postmortx-rays of this lesion?
unified_answer: This anteroposterior radiograph of the pelvis demonstrates bilateral protrusio acetabuli.  Further clinical information is needed to determine the underlying etiology.  A post-mortem radiograph would not differ significantly in appearance from an antemortem radiograph unless there were post-mortem changes to the bone such as fractures or decompositional changes. The question of "gross" findings cannot be answered from a radiograph, as this refers to macroscopic examination of the lesion itself, not an image of it.
